plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A small perennial flowering plant with cup-shaped, showy flowers that often bloom in late winter to early spring, signaling the end of winter. These bulbs produce vibrant flowers emerging through snow in cooler climates.
plants.location: Europe, particularly Mediterranean regions and temperate zones
plants.funFact: Crocuses are among the first bulbs to bloom after winter, sometimes even poking through snow!

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub known for its large, rose-like blooms that appear during winter and early spring. Popular in gardens for its glossy foliage and striking flowers.
plants.location: East Asia (Japan, China, Korea) and cultivated worldwide in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica flowers have been used in traditional East Asian art and tea ceremonies.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: A tree native to eastern Australia that produces striking cylindrical flower spikes containing hundreds of tiny flowers. It blooms in the austral summer and can last into the early autumn months.
plants.funFact: Banksias are an important nectar source for many Australian birds and mammals.

plants.name: Winter Jasmine
plants.description: A hardy deciduous shrub known for its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter, often before leaf emergence. It adds color to gardens during the dull winter months.
plants.location: Native to China and Korea; cultivated in temperate regions globally
plants.funFact: Winter jasmine blooms on leafless stems, making its yellow flowers particularly prominent against a winter landscape.
